definitions.title: adj.
definitions.body: outer, external (opp. [[פְּנִימִי]]) f. [[חִיחוֹנָה]] (for [[חוֹחוֹן]], by dissim., Ba:NB xxix Phil:BAS ii. 2. 362 Ges:§ 27. 3 R 6)—

2Ki 16:18 [[מְבוֹא הִמֶלֶךְ]] [[הַחִיחוֹנָה]] the outer entry of the king (viz. to the Temple), Ez Eze 44:1 the outer gate of the sanctuary, [[החחר החיחונךְ]] the outer court (of the Temple) Ez Eze 10:5, Eze 40:17, Eze 40:20, Eze 40:31, Eze 40:34, Eze 40:37, Eze 42:1, Eze 42:3, Eze 42:7, Eze 42:8, Eze 42:9, Eze 42:14, Eze 44:19, Eze 44:1, Eze 46:9, Eze 46:20, Eze 46:21, cf. Es 6:4 (of Ahasuerus' palace), 2Ch 33:14 ´[[חוֹמָה ח]] an outer wall (built by Manasseh for the [[עִיר דָּוִיד]]); [[הַחִיחוֹן]] absol., in [[לַחִיחוֹן]] 1Ki 6:29, 1Ki 6:30, [[בַּחִיחוֹן]] Ez Eze 41:17 ([[הַבַּיִת]] being understood) of the outer (part of the Temple), i.e. the Holy Place (cf. [[פְּנִימִי]], [[פְּנִימָה]], of the Holy of holies).

fig. outward, external [[הַמְּלָאכָה הַחִיחוֹנָה]] Ne 11:16, 1Ch 26:29, of business not distinctively sacred, in which Levites were engaged (cf. The NH use of ´[[ח]] to denote extra-canonical, as Sanh. 1Ch 10:1 [Jost, 1Ch 11:1 Surenh.] [[ספרים החיחונים]]).
